Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic red-figured pottery semi-open vase; interior: unslipped at top of sherd and glazed streaky brown below; exterior: male figure in cloak (beard, cloak and raised right arm remaining) to right; at right possibly shoulder of second figure.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0988)
